channel.title: Lists on Rob's Notes
channel.description: Recent content in Lists on Rob's Notes

item.title: Leadership - Essential Books
item.description: The following two quotes sum up my ideal of leadership. “The greatest leader is not necessarily the one who does the greatest things. He is the one that gets the people to do the greatest things.” ~ Ronald Reagan “A leader is best when people barely know he exists. When his work is done, his aim fulfilled, they will say: we did it ourselves.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Favorite TV Title Sequence Themes
item.description: Was listening to the awesome title sequence of His Dark Materials again today. It is one of those pieces of music that keep replaying in your mind even after you stop listening to it. I love listening to Intro sequence themes and there are some iconic ones among American TV shows.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Software Development - Essential Books
item.description: As a person who loves checking off items in ‘to-do’ lists and checklists, I’ve always liked books that have a list of rules/principles. Hence books like Effective Java, 201 Principles are the ones that come to mind when I think of a reading list of books related to Software Development.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: A Cybersecurity Book List
item.description: Background While writing a note about My Reading Journey, I was reminded that I hadn’t put a section on list of books related to Computer Science in My Reading List. Been thinking of doing that. Will do it one of these days. Today’s WSJ had a section in the end on Cybersecurity.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Favorite Poems
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Reading List
item.description: Last Updated - 06/06/2020 List of books that I have read, started to read, heard a lot about and want to read. I can at least talk one sentence about these books. Have written a draft of my Reading Journey which is a short recollection of what I read when.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Quotes on Learning
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Quotes
item.description: “Nothing in the world can take the place of Persistence. Talent will not; nothing is more common than unsuccessful men with talent. Genius will not; unrewarded genius is almost a proverb. Education will not; the world is full of educated derelicts. Persistence and determination alone are omnipotent. The slogan ‘Press On’ has solved and always will solve the problems of the human race.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju
